trans-unit.source: How can I setup HTTPS Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for Team Foundation Server
trans-unit.target: How can I setup HTTPS Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for Team Foundation Server

trans-unit.source: You can strengthen the security of your deployment of Visual Studio Team Foundation Server (TFS) by configuring it to use Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) with Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).
trans-unit.target: You can strengthen the security of your deployment of Visual Studio Team Foundation Server (TFS) by configuring it to use Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) with Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).

trans-unit.source: You can choose either to require this protocol, which maximizes the security of your deployment, or you can choose to support HTTPS with SSL in addition to the default protocol, HTTP.
trans-unit.target: You can choose either to require this protocol, which maximizes the security of your deployment, or you can choose to support HTTPS with SSL in addition to the default protocol, HTTP.

trans-unit.source: If you use Release Management for Visual Studio 2013, you can also configure that to use HTTPS with SSL, although you cannot configure it to support both HTTP and HTTPS with SSL.
trans-unit.target: If you use Release Management for Visual Studio 2013, you can also configure that to use HTTPS with SSL, although you cannot configure it to support both HTTP and HTTPS with SSL.

trans-unit.source: Before you choose a configuration, review the advantages and disadvantages described here.
trans-unit.target: Before you choose a configuration, review the advantages and disadvantages described here.

trans-unit.source: After you identify the configuration that best meets the security needs of your organization, follow the steps in this topic to configure your deployment.
trans-unit.target: After you identify the configuration that best meets the security needs of your organization, follow the steps in this topic to configure your deployment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see Setting up HTTPS with Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for Team Foundation Server
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see Setting up HTTPS with Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for Team Foundation Server
